00345 #ifndef M2_FLAGS_DEFINED
00346 #define M2_FLAGS_DEFINED
00347 
00362 #define M2_ZERO_MEMORY          (1<<0)
00363 
00377 #define M2_PREVENT_MOVE         (1<<1)
00378 
00393 #define M2_ALWAYS_MMAP          (1<<2)
00394 #define M2_RESERVED1            (1<<3)
00395 #define M2_RESERVED2            (1<<4)
00396 #define M2_RESERVED3            (1<<5)
00397 #define M2_RESERVED4            (1<<6)
00398 #define M2_RESERVED5            (1<<7)
00399 #define M2_RESERVE_ISMULTIPLIER (1<<15)
00400 /* 7 bits is given to the address reservation specifier.
00401 This lets you set a multiplier (bit 15 set) or a 1<< shift value.
00402 */
00403 #define M2_RESERVE_MASK         0x00007f00
00404 
00410 #define M2_RESERVE_MULT(n)      (M2_RESERVE_ISMULTIPLIER|(((n)<<8)&M2_RESERVE_MASK))
00411 
00417 #define M2_RESERVE_SHIFT(n)     (((n)<<8)&M2_RESERVE_MASK)
00418 #define M2_FLAGS_MASK           0x0000ffff
00419 #define M2_CUSTOM_FLAGS_BEGIN   (1<<16)
00420 #define M2_CUSTOM_FLAGS_MASK    0xffff0000
00421 
00427 #define NM_SKIP_TOLERANCE_CHECKS (1<<31)
00428 #endif /* M2_FLAGS_DEFINED */

00833         /* Roll on variadic templates is all I can say! */
00834 #ifdef HAVE_CPP0XVARIADICTEMPLATES
00835         template<class Base, template<class> class... policies> class policycompositor
00836         {
00837         public:
00838                 typedef policies<policies...> value;
00839         };
00840 #else
00841         template<class Impl,
00842                         template<class> class A=nedpolicy::empty,
00843                         template<class> class B=nedpolicy::empty,
00844                         template<class> class C=nedpolicy::empty,
00845                         template<class> class D=nedpolicy::empty,
00846                         template<class> class E=nedpolicy::empty,
00847                         template<class> class F=nedpolicy::empty,
00848                         template<class> class G=nedpolicy::empty,
00849                         template<class> class H=nedpolicy::empty,
00850                         template<class> class I=nedpolicy::empty,
00851                         template<class> class J=nedpolicy::empty,
00852                         template<class> class K=nedpolicy::empty,
00853                         template<class> class L=nedpolicy::empty,
00854                         template<class> class M=nedpolicy::empty,
00855                         template<class> class N=nedpolicy::empty,
00856                         template<class> class O=nedpolicy::empty
00857                 > class policycompositor
00858         {
00859                 typedef policycompositor<Impl, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O> temp;
00860         public:
00861                 typedef A<typename temp::value> value;
00862         };
00863 #endif
00864         template<class Impl> class policycompositor<Impl>
00865         {
00866         public:
00867                 typedef Impl value;
00868         };
00869 }
00870 
00871 template<typename T,
00872 #ifdef HAVE_CPP0XVARIADICTEMPLATES
00873         template<class> class... policies
00874 #else
00875         template<class> class policy1=nedpolicy::empty,
00876         template<class> class policy2=nedpolicy::empty,
00877         template<class> class policy3=nedpolicy::empty,
00878         template<class> class policy4=nedpolicy::empty,
00879         template<class> class policy5=nedpolicy::empty,
00880         template<class> class policy6=nedpolicy::empty,
00881         template<class> class policy7=nedpolicy::empty,
00882         template<class> class policy8=nedpolicy::empty,
00883         template<class> class policy9=nedpolicy::empty,
00884         template<class> class policy10=nedpolicy::empty,
00885         template<class> class policy11=nedpolicy::empty,
00886         template<class> class policy12=nedpolicy::empty,
00887         template<class> class policy13=nedpolicy::empty,
00888         template<class> class policy14=nedpolicy::empty,
00889         template<class> class policy15=nedpolicy::empty
00890 #endif
00891 > class nedallocator;

00893 namespace nedallocatorI
00894 {
00896         template<class implementation> class baseimplementation
00897         {
00898                 //NEDSTATIC_ASSERT(false, Bad_policies_specified);
00899         };
00901         template<typename T,
00902 #ifdef HAVE_CPP0XVARIADICTEMPLATES
00903                 template<class> class... policies
00904 #else
00905                 template<class> class policy1,
00906                 template<class> class policy2,
00907                 template<class> class policy3,
00908                 template<class> class policy4,
00909                 template<class> class policy5,
00910                 template<class> class policy6,
00911                 template<class> class policy7,
00912                 template<class> class policy8,
00913                 template<class> class policy9,
00914                 template<class> class policy10,
00915                 template<class> class policy11,
00916                 template<class> class policy12,
00917                 template<class> class policy13,
00918                 template<class> class policy14,
00919                 template<class> class policy15
00920 #endif
00921         > class baseimplementation<nedallocator<T,
00922 #ifdef HAVE_CPP0XVARIADICTEMPLATES
00923 policies...
00924 #else
00925         policy1, policy2, policy3, policy4, policy5,
00926         policy6, policy7, policy8, policy9, policy10,
00927         policy11, policy12, policy13, policy14, policy15
00928 #endif
00929         > >
00930         {
00931         protected:
00933                 typedef nedallocator<T,
00934 #ifdef HAVE_CPP0XVARIADICTEMPLATES
00935                         policies...
00936 #else
00937                         policy1, policy2, policy3, policy4, policy5,
00938                         policy6, policy7, policy8, policy9, policy10,
00939                         policy11, policy12, policy13, policy14, policy15
00940 #endif
00941                 > implementationType;
00943                 implementationType *_this() { return static_cast<implementationType *>(this); }
00945                 const implementationType *_this() const { return static_cast<const implementationType *>(this); }
00947                 nedpool *policy_nedpool(size_t bytes) const
00948                 {
00949                         return 0;
00950                 }
00952                 size_t policy_granularity(size_t bytes) const
00953                 {
00954                         return bytes;
00955                 }
00957                 size_t policy_alignment(size_t bytes) const
00958                 {
00959                         return 0;
00960                 }
00962                 unsigned policy_flags(size_t bytes) const
00963                 {
00964                         return 0;
00965                 }
00967                 void policy_throwbadalloc(size_t bytes) const
00968                 {
00969                         throw std::bad_alloc();
00970                 }
00972                 static const bool policy_typeIsPOD=
00973 #ifdef HAVE_CPP0XTYPETRAITS
00974                         is_pod<T>::value;
00975 #else
00976                         false;
00977 #endif
00978         public:
00979                 typedef T *pointer;
00980                 typedef const T *const_pointer;
00981                 typedef T &reference;
00982                 typedef const T &const_reference;
00983                 typedef T value_type;
00984                 typedef size_t size_type;
00985                 typedef ptrdiff_t difference_type;
00986                 T *address(T &r) const { return &r; }
00987                 const T *address(const T &s) const { return &s; }
00988                 size_t max_size() const { return (static_cast<size_t>(0) - static_cast<size_t>(1)) / sizeof(T); }
00989                 bool operator!=(const baseimplementation &other) const { return !(*this == other); }
00990                 bool operator==(const baseimplementation &other) const { return true; }
00991 
00992                 void construct(T *const p, const T &t) const {
00993                         void *const _p = static_cast<void *>(p);
00994                         new (_p) T(t);
00995                 }
00996                 void destroy(T *const p) const {
00997                         p->~T();
00998                 }
00999                 baseimplementation() { }
01000                 baseimplementation(const baseimplementation &) { }
01001 #ifdef HAVE_CPP0XRVALUEREFS
01002                 baseimplementation(baseimplementation &&) { }
01003 #endif
01004                 template<typename U> struct rebind {
01005                         typedef nedallocator<U,
01006 #ifdef HAVE_CPP0XVARIADICTEMPLATES
01007                                 policies...
01008 #else
01009                                 policy1, policy2, policy3, policy4, policy5,
01010                                 policy6, policy7, policy8, policy9, policy10,
01011                                 policy11, policy12, policy13, policy14, policy15
01012 #endif
01013                         > other;
01014                 };
01015                 template<typename U> baseimplementation(const nedallocator<U,
01016 #ifdef HAVE_CPP0XVARIADICTEMPLATES
01017                         policies...
01018 #else
01019                         policy1, policy2, policy3, policy4, policy5,
01020                         policy6, policy7, policy8, policy9, policy10,
01021                         policy11, policy12, policy13, policy14, policy15
01022 #endif
01023                 > &) { }
01024 
01025                 T *allocate(const size_t n) const {
01026                         // Leave these spelled out to aid debugging
01027                         const size_t t_size = sizeof(T);
01028                         size_t size = _this()->policy_granularity(n*t_size);
01029                         nedpool *pool = _this()->policy_nedpool(size);
01030                         size_t alignment = _this()->policy_alignment(size);
01031                         unsigned flags = _this()->policy_flags(size);
01032                         void *ptr = nedpmalloc2(pool, size, alignment, flags);
01033                         if(!ptr)
01034                                 _this()->policy_throwbadalloc(size);
01035                         return static_cast<T *>(ptr);
01036                 }
01037                 void deallocate(T *p, const size_t n) const {
01038                         nedpfree(0/*not needed*/, p);
01039                 }
01040                 template<typename U> T *allocate(const size_t n, const U * /* hint */) const {
01041                         return allocate(n);
01042                 }
01043         private:
01044                 baseimplementation &operator=(const baseimplementation &);
01045         };
01046 
01047 }
01048 
01049 namespace nedpolicy
01050 {
01058         template<size_t granularity> struct granulate
01059         {
01060                 template<class Base> class policy : public Base
01061                 {
01062                         template<class implementation> friend class nedallocatorI::baseimplementation;
01063                 protected:
01064                         size_t policy_granularity(size_t bytes) const
01065                         {
01066                                 return (bytes+granularity-1) & ~(granularity-1);
01067                         }
01068                 };
01069         };
01074         template<size_t alignment> struct align
01075         {
01076                 template<class Base> class policy : public Base
01077                 {
01078                         template<class implementation> friend class nedallocatorI::baseimplementation;
01079                 protected:
01080                         size_t policy_alignment(size_t bytes) const
01081                         {
01082                                 return alignment;
01083                         }
01084                 };
01085         };
01090         template<bool dozero=true> struct zero
01091         {
01092                 template<class Base> class policy : public Base
01093                 {
01094                         template<class implementation> friend class nedallocatorI::baseimplementation;
01095                 protected:
01096                         unsigned policy_flags(size_t bytes) const
01097                         {
01098                                 return dozero ? Base::policy_flags(bytes)|M2_ZERO_MEMORY : Base::policy_flags(bytes);
01099                         }
01100                 };
01101         };
01106         template<bool doprevent=true> struct preventmove
01107         {
01108                 template<class Base> class policy : public Base
01109                 {
01110                         template<class implementation> friend class nedallocatorI::baseimplementation;
01111                 protected:
01112                         unsigned policy_flags(size_t bytes) const
01113                         {
01114                                 return doprevent ? Base::policy_flags(bytes)|M2_PREVENT_MOVE : Base::policy_flags(bytes);
01115                         }
01116                 };
01117         };
01122         template<bool dommap=true> struct mmap
01123         {

01125                 {
01126                         template<class implementation> friend class nedallocatorI::baseimplementation;
01127                 protected:
01128                         unsigned policy_flags(size_t bytes) const
01129                         {
01130                                 return dommap ? Base::policy_flags(bytes)|M2_ALWAYS_MMAP : Base::policy_flags(bytes);
01131                         }
01132                 };
01133         };

01141                 {

01143                 protected:

01145                         {
01146                                 return Base::policy_flags(bytes)|M2_RESERVE_MULT(X);
01147                         }
01148                 };
01149         };

01161                         {

01163                         }
01164                 };
01165         };

01288         /* This templated constructor and rebind() are used by MSVC's secure iterator checker.
01289         I think it's best to not copy state even though it may break policies which store data. */

01313 #ifdef HAVE_CPP0XVARIADICTEMPLATES
01314                         policies...
01315 #else

01323 
01324 namespace nedallocatorI {
01325         // Holds a static allocator instance shared by anything allocating from allocator
01326         template<class allocator> struct StaticAllocator
01327         {
01328                 static allocator &get()
01329                 {
01330                         static allocator a;
01331                         return a;
01332                 }
01333         };
01334         // RAII holder for a Newed object
01335         template<typename T, class allocator> struct PtrHolder
01336         {
01337                 T *mem;
01338                 PtrHolder(T *_mem) : mem(_mem) { }
01339                 ~PtrHolder()
01340                 {
01341                         if(mem)
01342                         {
01343                                 allocator &a=nedallocatorI::StaticAllocator<allocator>::get();
01344                                 a.deallocate(mem, sizeof(T));
01345                                 mem=0;
01346                         }
01347                 }
01348                 T *release() { T *ret=mem; mem=0; return ret; }
01349                 T *operator *() { return mem; }
01350                 const T *operator *() const { return mem; }
01351         };
01352 }
01363 #ifdef HAVE_CPP0XVARIADICTEMPLATES
01364 template<typename T, class allocator=nedallocator<T>, typename... Parameters> inline T *New(const Parameters&... parameters)
01365 #else
01366 template<typename T, class allocator> inline T *New()
01367 #endif
01368 {
01369         allocator &a=nedallocatorI::StaticAllocator<allocator>::get();
01370         nedallocatorI::PtrHolder<T, allocator> ret(a.allocate(sizeof(T)));
01371         if(*ret)
01372         {
01373 #ifdef HAVE_CPP0XVARIADICTEMPLATES
01374                 new((void *) *ret) T(parameters...);
01375 #else
01376                 new((void *) *ret) T;
01377 #endif
01378         }
01379         return ret.release();
01380 }
01381 #ifndef HAVE_CPP0XVARIADICTEMPLATES
01382 // Extremely annoying not to have default template arguments for functions pre-C++0x
01383 template<typename T> inline T *New()
01384 {
01385         return New<T, nedallocator<T> >();
01386 }
01387 // Also, it's painful to replicate function overloads :(
01388 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPL \
01389 template<typename T, class allocator, NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLTYPES> inline T *New(NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARSDEFS) \
01390 { \
01391         allocator &a=nedallocatorI::StaticAllocator<allocator>::get(); \
01392         nedallocatorI::PtrHolder<T, allocator> ret(a.allocate(sizeof(T))); \
01393         if(*ret) \
01394         { \
01395                 new((void *) *ret) T(NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARS); \
01396         } \
01397         return ret.release(); \
01398 } \
01399 template<typename T, NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLTYPES> inline T *New(NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARSDEFS)\
01400 { \
01401         return New<T, nedallocator<T> >(NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARS); \
01402 }
01403 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLTYPES typename P1
01404 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARSDEFS const P1 &p1
01405 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARS p1
01406 NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPL
01407 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLTYPES
01408 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARSDEFS
01409 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARS
01410 
01411 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLTYPES typename P1, typename P2
01412 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARSDEFS const P1 &p1, const P2 &p2
01413 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARS p1, p2
01414 NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPL
01415 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLTYPES
01416 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARSDEFS
01417 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARS
01418 
01419 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLTYPES typename P1, typename P2, typename P3
01420 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARSDEFS const P1 &p1, const P2 &p2, const P3 &p3
01421 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARS p1, p2, p3
01422 NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPL
01423 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLTYPES
01424 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARSDEFS
01425 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARS
01426 
01427 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLTYPES typename P1, typename P2, typename P3, typename P4
01428 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARSDEFS const P1 &p1, const P2 &p2, const P3 &p3, const P4 &p4
01429 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARS p1, p2, p3, p4
01430 NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPL
01431 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLTYPES
01432 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARSDEFS
01433 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARS
01434 
01435 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLTYPES typename P1, typename P2, typename P3, typename P4, typename P5
01436 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARSDEFS const P1 &p1, const P2 &p2, const P3 &p3, const P4 &p4, const P5 &p5
01437 #define NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARS p1, p2, p3, p4, p5
01438 NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPL
01439 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLTYPES
01440 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARSDEFS
01441 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPLPARS
01442 
01443 #undef NEDMALLOC_NEWIMPL
01444 #endif
01445 
01448 template<class allocator, typename T> inline void Delete(const T *_obj)
01449 {
01450         T *obj=const_cast<T *>(_obj);
01451         allocator &a=nedallocatorI::StaticAllocator<allocator>::get();
01452         obj->~T();
01453         a.deallocate(obj, sizeof(T));
01454 }
01455 template<typename T> inline void Delete(const T *obj) { Delete<nedallocator<T> >(obj); }
